column3: Mean chamber CO~2~ concentration during flux measurement
Mean chamber CH~4~ concentration during flux measurement
Ambient CO~2~ concentration at measurement chamber
Ambient CH~4~ concentration at measurement chamber
CO2 flux computation method ("Lin" or "Exp" for linear and exponential)
CH4 flux computation method ("Lin" or "Exp" for linear and exponential)
Error raised by instrument or during import
Photosynthetically active radiation inside measurement chamber
Photosynthetically active radiation outside measurement chamber
Chamber relative humidity during flux measurement
Volumetric soil moisture at x cm (other CSR_SMx fields follow same format)
Soil oxygen level at measurement chamber
Soil temperature at x cm (other CSR_Tx fields follow same format)
Ambient air temperature at measurement chamber
Chamber air temperature during flux measurement
Timestamp of beginning of flux observation, written YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS
Timestamp of end of flux observation, written YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS
Vapor pressure deficit at measurement chamber
Water table depth at measurement chamber (positive numbers = depth)
Raw data timestamp format, in R's `strptime()` format
Instrument timestamp timezone; usually but not always the same as CSR_TIMEZONE. . From https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones
Embargo flag. If this field is present, data will not be released
Flux should be interpreted as: "Rs" (soil respiration, whether CO2 or CH4), "Rh" (heterotrophic respiration only), "Reco" (ecosystem respiratino), or "NEE" (net ecosystem exchange)
Comma-separated depths of solid-state sensors, gradient method only
Decimal longitude of measurement chamber, positive = north
Decimal latitude of measurement chamber, positive = east

column1: # `columns`: mapping of raw data columns to COSORE columns

column3: Optional R computation to be performed changing units, etc.
Timestamp of beginning of ancillary observation (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS)
Timestamp of end of ancillary observation (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS)
Date (YYYY or YYYY-MM or YYYY-MM-DD) of which ancillary measurements are representative; this and the timestamps fields should not both be filled out
Statistic being reported in this row, following AmeriFlux controlled vocabulary (Mean, Max, Standard Deviation, Measurement Uncertainty, Single observation, Expert estimate, etc.)
Net ecosystem production, typically biometric (positive = carbon sink)
Water table depth at chamber (positive = depth)
If no measurement length is provided this is set to assumed value
Number of observations removed for error code
Number of observations removed for missing flux
Number of observations removed for bad timestamp
Timestamp of first flux observation, written YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS
Timestamp of last flux observation, written YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS
